name: Premier Inn Inverness Centre - River Ness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel. Brilliant breakfast worth paying for.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Comfertable, quiet rooms.
reviews.title: LOVELY NEW HOTEL IN CENTRAL INVERNESS

reviews.text: Staff very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Good location, great staff

reviews.text: Well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Great central location, great value for money

reviews.text: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: This was my first experience of a premier inn, an I wouldn't think twice about coming back. The rooms are clean, well maintained and has some good views (depending on location in the hotel). The staff are pleasant and helpful. Will stay here again.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This branch of Premier Inns is right on the River Ness so the location to town sights is great. There are nice restaurants nearby and a coin laundry around the corner.
reviews.title: Clean, unpretentious, and conveniently located.

reviews.text: All the comments about the parking are correct: don't count on there being any, but the public parking lot behind St. Andrew's Cathedral is very close (I think it's fair to say a 3-5 minute walk rather than 10 minutes) and cheap as well.
reviews.title: best stay in inverness by far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is great and offered over several hours. While I didn't like the sealed windows, the air conditioning unit kept the room airy and cool. We requested a room facing away from the river to avoid noise at night and slept soundly.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Location

reviews.text: we just stayed there for 4 days exellent service from all the staff best value by a mile food was amazing definately be back went to the movies and on the way back all the lights where on totally amazing
reviews.title: A jewel in Inverness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't have pre-conceived ideas about this because it is a premier inn. Dont think you should pay more and you will get a better service elsewhere. You wont! Like all premier inns, the rooms are done to a pro-forma but this hotel just does everything better. I have stayed in a LOT of premier inns and this is the best by far. The staff just could NOT have been more helpful or friendly. The location is superb - right in the centre overlooking the river. The restaurant is really excellent - great food, attentive service. After eating there on the first night from tiredness, we chose to eat there every night, working our way through the menu! Breakfast was wow. Fresh, crisp fruit, nicely cooked food. Any down sides? The only one we found was finding the car park. It is in a one way system so we passed it a few times before working out where to turn. It is small but we always managed to park there. Will definitely stay here again. Premier Inn - you should roll out what this hotel does throughout your chain - a really great example.
reviews.title: Forget the rest...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time we had used this hotel.
reviews.title: Premier Inn Ness Bank Inverness

reviews.text: Great location in the centre of town, on the riverside. We had a room with river view which made things even better.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: Staff were very friendly and enthusiastic and couldn't do enough to help.
reviews.title: Needs a drying facility for boots

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price was reasonable and we will definitely be going back again.
reviews.title: Its a Premier Inn in a great location

reviews.text: This was my first experience with a Premier Inn, and I found it OK for a one night stay. There is really very little parking for this hotel. They might have ten parking spots in back, so you are really stuck parking on the street. Spots do open up in the evening, but as we arrived, there was nothing close by, so unloading baggage was very inconvenient. The very small elevators didn't help.
reviews.title: OK for one night

reviews.text: As we stepped into the lobby, the restaurant looked OK, but the actually lobby entrance was well-worn and a bit scruffy. Not terrible, but very much similar to a college dorm sort of feel. The welcome was not terribly warm, although I would say it was adequate. The halls are a bit depressingly decorated. The rooms appeared clean, and although the pillows were very thin, I found the bedding to be all right. We got one of the front rooms overlooking the Ness River. This appeared, from the outside, to be quite charming, with a large terrace in front of the room. However, the terrace was really filled with bird poop and feathers, so looking out there was no treat. Can't say I would really recommend this view to future guests.
reviews.title: Top hotel in a fab location

reviews.text: So, I can't really say I would stay here again. We ended up there because of a last-minute change in our schedule, so I can't say what would be better in Inverness. The location was good, right in the center of town, and we had a very nice dinner at Rocpool which is very close at hand, and was a charming stop. But the hotel didn't live up to the expectations that I had from reading the Trip Advisor reviews.
reviews.title: Excellent location, usual Premier Inn quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was really amazing for the price. Check-in was great, staff were efficient and friendly. They even got me a jug of ice from the bar. Room was lovely, clean, huge and so comfortable. Great price. Can't fault it and the location was perfect for Inverness centre.
reviews.title: VERY GOOD

reviews.text: Well done Premier Inn, faultless!
reviews.title: Twin room is 2 single beds, not a king size double and a child bed tucked next to window

aka: Premier Inn Inverness Centre - River Ness Scotland
